page.title: 20ATTITUDES
page.content: There still remain on the south side of Brockenhurst sizeable pockets of open grazing land, an asset fast disappearing elsewhere in the village, green punctuation marks in a rapidly developing village, a village under pressure. These open areas allow the village to breathe, allow the eye to rest from the ever increasing number of concrete tiled roofs. They stem the flow of rural character from the village. Planners and landowners must recognise the value of these open spaces and must resist financial pressure - no matter how heavily applied - to allow further blanket development, otherwise Brockenhurst will become as dull and as lifeless as Surburbia and will cease to be a Forest Village.
